alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 24 at 7:10PM CDT until May 24 at 7:45PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM CDT FOR EAST CENTRAL FRANKLIN COUNTY... At 710 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 2 miles west of Wiederkehr Village to 4 miles southeast of Denning, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations in or near the path include... Ozark... Altus... Denning... Wiederkehr Village... Alix... This includes Interstate 40 in Arkansas between mile markers 33 and 42. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
